title: I want to start a bakery shop so what should I do first then what is the plan for it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Do your market research first. Is there a need for a bakery in the area that you want to put it in? If yes what are the costs associated with it? Costs like rent , ingredients , machinery licensing etc etc. Do you have the necessary skills to carry such a business? If not look into hiring someone who does. What is your brand? You need to brand your business thats how people differentiate you from the rest. How are you goin to market your business? Are goin to do print or digital marketing. What are you going to sell? will you follow current trends such as cupcakes etc? Who is your customer? Are you in a niche market? Believe in yourself and you will do it. Remember talk is cheap you need to follow through . These are some of the things l look at. I will keep adding more its just that im pressed for time now and thought you needed something to work on in the meanwhile.

Your idea is noble, but too broad. What are your specialties? Breads, cakes, pastries, other? Narrow done the product line, test market some of your goods and see what clients like. While establishing a group of clients and a product line, location scout. Be aware of the competition and proximity. A bakery needs foot traffic and that means a strip mall or business district or hotel(s). Office complex is doable, too. You’ll need to determine a good price point for your items. And of course, the usual: P.R., marketing, accounting, banking, etc. Good luck!
